resources.string:
Warning: Translations are not exact!
 For example, "Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­ÛŒÙ…" is often translated as "The Most Gracious, The Most Merciful".
 But in Arabic, both words share the same root "R-H-M",
 which refers to compassion that flows from a private "R-H-M"
 (It has no English equivalent - Union with the Divine Attributes 
 With the help of the principles of Taqva(Quran Principles) which leads to private R-H-M)
 to a public "R-H-M" (mercy - General Welfare).
 It reflects an attribute of ALLAH also present in humans â€” the source
 of creation and the act of giving without being asked.
 None of these layers of meaning are captured in a simple translation.
